body: In general, it is not advised to combine functional and non-functional (formatting) changes into a single merge/diff. It makes the merge evaluation process a bit more difficult.

In the code, there is only addition of new global configuration. This global configuration is not used for any validations or data management. There will not be any change to existing APIs whatsoever. Such global configurations are not going to help in any way.
Issue Number FINERACT-62
Issue no FINERACT-66.
Instead of making two commits I will be making 1 single commit and create another pull request.

KoustavMuhuri, Could you please add the same notes for Savings Transactions - Deposit and Withdrawal + Undo Transaction for Savings Transactions
Issue at Jira is at https://mifosforge.jira.com/browse/MIFOSX-2620

Thanks

JIRA issue not mentioned, I couldn't understand the requirement for this PR. May be you can make use of Notes APIs. Please discuss your requirement and solution approach in dev forum for clarity and help.

As of now, Income account client charges are defined while defining the charges. We would suggest the same place to add advanced GLaccount mappings for different payment types as well. Solution as provided in PR, in my opinion, splits the way GL accounts mappings are defined across portfolio as of now. Also allowing to define fund source account id at payment type definition could mislead the user into believing that the definition is valid across the portfolios. In the future also new use cases could come up which might make this solution non-extendable.
Sir,Thanks for your observations. I have noted down the observations.
This PR has compilation issues
missed to add SQL script to adding column

Hi anurgamath, Thanks for your PR. However the platform already supports extending the datamodel through datatables. This allows different implementers to setup exactly those fields they need for their specific setup. In this way we can keep the core client object (and code) clean and tidy, and only put properties in it that are required by other objects to function (mobile_no etc)

In addition we prefer for people to squash their commits before making a PR, this allows us to keep the commit history clean.
Changes looks OK. But this pull request is having conflicts. Can you please resolve merge conflicts and send a pull request with a single commit.
can u please tell me how can i know about the merge conflicts

I assume your git remote name is upstream.
Run these two commands
git fetch upstream
git rebase upstream/develop
It will get the latest code and try to merge with your changes. If merge fails, it will show the files with conflicts.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-144
Please make use of existing notes feature instead of adding new columns in loan transaction table.
Can you please resolve conflicts and send the pull request again.
Re sending the PR after taking care of the suggested comments

Can you explain bit more why this change is required? 
Prerequisite for Fineract is Java 8. So no need to change the InterestRateChart  sort function.
There is integration tests for GroupLoanIndividualMonitoring.
integration test failure
will be resending the pull request
closed

Well, it is always great to be on top of things and use all the latest technologies but if you feel breaking backward compatibility because of one line is fine, then it is your call.

The other part of the PR is about easier setup where ServerApplication is by default included in the sourceSet, so for beginners, there won't be any need to change classpath exclusions before firing the server up. Dependency inclusion is because of excluding `EmbeddedTomcatWithSSLConfiguration` and commons-lang forking out commons-io as a separate dependency.
Pull request should have only your commit. I can see 186 other commits in this pull request.

Jira Issue Number: FINERACT-217

I believe we no need to have two boolean variables to extend the term.
1) extendTermForDailyRepayments
2) extendTermForRepaymentsOnHolidays 

We can have a single config extendTerm. If this config is enabled, generateNextRepaymentDate method should return adjusted date
Please close this PR.

extendTermForDailyRepayments flag is for a different purpose than extendTermForRepaymentsOnHolidays. There should be a way to specify which of the 2 is required and hence 2 bools. If a single bool is used, what is the behaviour if its set? Does it extend the term for both loans with daily repayment schedule and for holidays? What if the API user needs one of these 2 functionalities?
I agree to your point :-)
Please resolve the conflicts and send the PR again. We plan to review this next week, please provide us with requirement/design specs to help us with the review

You will have to add new SQL file with latest version, we cannot modify the old SQL script..... deployments that have already gone past v316 will not get this change.

Also, you cannot just change the STATE code_name to STATES by default..... If someone is using STATE as their custom code name value, it will affect their usage in their deployments.

You will have to find some intelligent solution that solves your problem and doesn't create problem for other existing deployments
@rajuan Thank you for your thoughts Adi. I have found a workaround which would not involve change in SQL files.
Can you please give more details why do we need to use spring-jms?
Remove all commented code

I have used jms to publish the generated notifications to a queue(implmented via ActiveMq) and then used the jmslistener to subscribe to that queue and listen for any new notification. More specifically, jms with ActiveMq has been used to make the generation and reception of messages to be asynchronous.
And Thanks for the review :smile: I will work on it.
@nazeer1100126  I performed the changes  using git commit --amend is it alright?
No, You need to send new PR
Okay I will

Have a look at how business events are implemented in Fineract. I believe the same way you can do it asynchronously by listening to required events. By this approach you no need to modify all API resources. 
I hope I am clear enough to you :-)

The subject line should be "New User Information" or 'Welcome to [Organization] Name'. I meant [Organization] should be replaced with Organization name.  Remove [ ]. Sorry that I was not clear enough in previous review comment.  :-(
Yeah thats fine, I'll send new PR
Hope this one is fine :-P

I think I have followed the same design as the implementation of business events.

> You no need to modify all API resources

I have used only the publish method call from the API resources like 
`this.publisher.publishEvent(Event Object)` similar to what the business design uses i.e `this.businessEventNotifierService.notifyBusinessEventToBeExecuted(some parameters)`

Reasons why me and my mentor(Pranjal) decided  to use an external queue :-
1. if we don't use an external queue we can be at a disadvantage of loosing messages if the listener ceases to stop working. 
2. This design follows pub-sub pattern which is nowadays generally used to design notification module.

I think the only difference is that business event design uses a Map to store the list of published events and my implementation uses an external queue.
So, should I refactor like the one suggested by you or proceed with my implementation ?
Thanks.
I see lot of files doesn't belongs to this PR. Please remove them and send the PR again.

@nazeer1100126 I made improvements to the message per the request of Santosh. I think the proposed change will simplify it even more. An e-mail message does not need to be that cluttered, especially for a login e-mail. Let me know what you think.

I am not a Gradle wizzard. But here is how I understand it. Gradle needs the gradle jar file to work. But what the change does it ensures that the right gradle version is used and you don't require the developer to  download and set up the right gradle version manually. If there is a requirement for a specific gradle version, it should be put in the build tool.
@maddingo Have you tested by removing existing gradle jar file? Is it downloading and build happening properly?

@abdulazizali77 we will accept PR(s) with a single commit to maintain cleaner history. Can you please send PR with a single commit.

@abdulazizali77 I am seeing following integration test failure with these changes ClientLoanIntegrationTest.testLoanScheduleWithInterestRecalculation_WITH_REST_SAME_AS_REPAYMENT_INTEREST_COMPOUND_NONE_STRATEGY_REDUCE_EMI_WITH_INSTALLMENT_CHARGE()
Have you run integration tests before sending this PR?
If the loan is enabled with Multi disbursements, recalculateAllCharges() method will be called twice while approving a loan with this change.
Would it be a better alternative to put it between the multi disbursement and approved loan amount blocks? It would run every time the approve loan function is called but it would run once.
@Eiliries Yes it is good to moving existing call from multidisbursement if condition.
@nazeer1100126 I've changed it so that it's called once and it works without any problems.
This PR is merged. But some reason, it is not closed.

However I doubt about my ability to fix these. The change so simple that I think the tests just send empty value and expect failure. And fix should be changes in tests, right?

@nazeer1100126 Hi, sorry i didnt run the integration test before. I did give the integration tests a run with and without the changes and it seems i get identical failures on ClientLoanIntegrationTest (and other tests).
I will ascertain whether the two modified methods in the PR are called during any of the integration tests. From first glance however testLoanScheduleWithInterestRecalculation_WITH_REST_SAME_AS_REPAYMENT_INTEREST_COMPOUND_NONE_STRATEGY_REDUCE_EMI_WITH_INSTALLMENT_CHARGE doesnt seem to be calling Loan.generateInstallmentLoanCharges nor LoanCharge.updateInstallmentCharges. (possibly i am wrong)

@anuragmath Can you mention Jira number as part of the PR. Without Jira details it will be difficult to validate the changes. PR should not have intelliJ files. Please send PR with single commit for cleaner history.

Changes looks OK. Basically you are capturing recurringFrequencyType
recurringFrequency data. But what is the use of these values?

For this PR, I just made them stored in the product and account so that they can be used. I think it should have an effect on the interest chart but I'm not sure how (especially considering there is a depositPeriodFrequency variable as well). The documentation specifies that these values should have been captured anyways, but they weren't working properly for a while.
